Subject:Re: Drunk at Reunification
Message 3371 of 4024
I might take Max, Parker, Adrian to Canada for a few days. Days tbd. Won’t interfere with any time.
Shall I send you authorization directly or through lawyers?
I’ve asked Parker parents to hold on their notarized statement.
If this is going to be a fight and cost thousands I’ll reconsider.
Sent:06/29/2024 at 07:09 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 06/29/2024 at 08:21 AM)
Subject:Canada travel authorization
Message 3372 of 4024
I don't want to argue, and neither do you, really. I think we just sometimes do it to each other out of unhealthy habits. You are pretty good about
recognizing it and stopping, so I'll ask for a truce this time.
I hope you will consider getting help for us; that's all at this point. Trying to win a point here or a point there does more collateral damage than it's
worth. "The juice is not worth the squeeze," as we said.
There is no harm in trying something new at this point. What is the worst that can happen? The courts would probably appreciate it if we could
proactively agree to some improvements before we see them.
If my suggestions make you uncomfortable, I'm all ears... honestly.
Sent:06/29/2024 at 08:38 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/29/2024 at 08:52 AM)
Subject:Re: Drunk at Reunification
Message 3373 of 4024
The jt BofA can be used for kids expenses as proposed and not personal spend.
Sent:06/29/2024 at 11:17 AM
From:Christine Moyer

Subject:Kids spend
